summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, documenting authorization for inmate Jeffrey Epstein to be fed meals in the attorney conference room on July 20, 2019. The memo notes Epstein received a 'common fare' meal and that this arrangement was to continue per instructions from a Lieutenant.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who was authorized to be fed his common fare meal in the attorney conference room on July 20, 2019.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The correctional officer who called the food service to request a meal be sent to the attorney conference room for inmate Epstein and authorized the ongoing arrangement.

connections.description: The Lieutenant authorized and arranged for inmate Epstein to be fed in the attorney conference room, indicating a supervisory/custodial relationship.

events.title: Epstein Fed in Attorney Conference Room
events.description: Food service at MCC received a call from Lt. requesting a regular meal tray be sent to the attorney conference room for inmate Epstein, who was meeting with his attorney. It was clarified Epstein received a 'common fare' meal, which was subsequently sent from his unit (9S) to the conference room.

events.title: Authorization for Ongoing Feeding Arrangement
events.description: The cook supervisor was notified that inmate Epstein was to be fed in the attorney conference room whenever he was there, as per the information received from Lt.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 20, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was in an attorney conference at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein was on a 'common fare' meal plan, not the regular inmate meal.
A Lieutenant at MCC authorized Epstein to be fed his meals in the attorney conference room, and this was established as an ongoing arrangement.
The document is a confidential internal Bureau of Prisons memorandum dated July 23, 2019, documenting this authorization.
